variant.question: What does the acronym IATA stand for?

options.text: International Air Transport Association
International Airline Training Association
International Airline Trade Agreement
International Air Trade Agreement

variant.question: Refer to the general organisation and objectives of IATA. The IATA is...

options.text: an international industry trade group of airlines which represents, leads and serves the airline industry.
an international organisation for efficient cooperation, innovation and assistance for telecommunications in aviation.
a multinational organisation for developing trade agreements in international scheduled and unscheduled aviation.
a section of the United Nations (UN) for international agreements in aviation.

variant.question: Which of these is a primary function of IATA?

options.text: To tackle critical issues in Aviation.
To perform the job of a lawyer in order to represent an Airline when they are being sued.
To give individual airlines policy guidelines.
To help airlines if they were indicted by a customer.

variant.question: Which one of the following statements applies to the general organisation and objectives of the IATA? â€“ The IATA is..

options.text: an international trade body which represents, leads and serves airline business in general.
a multi-national organisation for developing trade agreements in international aviation (scheduled and non-scheduled services).
an international organisation for innovation, efficient co-operation and assistance for telecommunications in aviation.
a specialised organisation of the United Nations for international air traffic agreements.

variant.question: What is the status of IATA ?

options.text: It is a trade association of aviation operators and others involved with international aviation.
It is an associate body ICAO.
It represents the air transport operators at ICAO.
It is the international legislative arm of ICAO.
